content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 18 to node 7 is:


```
18 -> 17 -> 9 -> 7
```
Note that the shortest path changes when the starting node is changed. In this case, changing the starting node from 18 to any other node would not change the shortest path. However, the format of the answer still remains the same: just a list of nodes in the shortest path in this case.

The shortest path from node 18 to node 9 is:


```scss
18 -> 17 -> 9
```
Note that this is the shortest path starting from node 18 and ending at node 9. The graph does not have a direct connection between nodes 9 and 7, so this path does not include node 7. If you need a different path, please provide the destination node.
